DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate efficacy postoperative pelvic floor muscle train use personalized extracorporeal biofeedback device among patient post-prostatectomy incontinence
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Extracorporeal Biofeedback Device Post-prostatectomy Incontinence
DOC.detailed_description: - Post prostatectomy urinary incontinence ( PPI ) common complication radical prostatectomy among prostate cancer patient . - The prevalence post-prostatectomy urinary incontinence report 87 % . - The pelvic floor muscle therapy ( PFMT ) use Kegel exercise first method prevent PPI prostatectomy . - However , standardize protocol PFMT necessary biofeedback PFMT . - Therefore , hypothesis efficacy personalize device PFMT biofeedback among patient underwent radical prostatectomy - In study , evaluate efficacy postoperative pelvic floor muscle train use personalized extracorporeal biofeedback device among patient post-prostatectomy incontinence .
DOC.criteria: Prostate cancer patient underwent robotic radical prostatectomy Neurovascular save least one side Bladder neck reconstruction prostatectomy Posterior reconstruction prostatectomy Patients postprostatectomy incontinence Foley catheter removal Patients postprostatectomy incontinence Foley catheter removal Neurological deficit Anatomic deformity pelvic bone Pelvic irradiation history History major urological procedure Complications influence urinary incontinence
